title: Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject
name: StorageObject
description: Objects are the individual pieces of data that you store in Google Cloud Storage.

params.name: connection
params.description: Represents a connection to Cloud Storage.

params.name: name
params.description: The object's name.

params.name: bucket
params.description: The name of the bucket the object is contained in.

params.name: generation
params.description: The generation of the object.

params.name: info
params.description: The object's metadata.

params.name: encryptionKey
params.description: An AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: The SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check whether or not the object exists.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifGenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update the object. Upon receiving a result the local object's data will be updated.

examples.caption: Add custom metadata to an existing object.

params.name: metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifGenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either 'full' or 'noAcl'.

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

methods.name: copy
methods.description:
Copy the object to a destination bucket.

Please note that if the destination bucket is the same as the source bucket and a new name is not provided the source object will be replaced with the copy of itself.

examples.caption: Provide your destination bucket as a string and retain the source object's name.
Provide your destination bucket as a bucket object and choose a new name for the copied object.

params.name: destination
params.description: The destination bucket.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination object. Defaults to the name of the source object.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifGenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceGenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

methods.name: rewrite
methods.description:
Rewrite the object to a destination bucket.

This method copies data using multiple requests so large objects can be copied with a normal length timeout per request rather than one very long timeout for a single request.

Please note that if the destination bucket is the same as the source bucket and a new name is not provided the source object will be replaced with the copy of itself.

examples.caption: Provide your destination bucket as a string and retain the source object's name.
Provide your destination bucket as a bucket object and choose a new name for the copied object.
Rotate customer-supplied encryption keys.

params.name: destination
params.description: The destination bucket.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination object. Defaults to the name of the source object.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.maxBytesRewrittenPerCall
params.description: The maximum number of bytes that will be rewritten per rewrite request. Most callers shouldn't need to specify this parameter - it is primarily in place to support testing. If specified the value must be an integral multiple of 1 MiB (1048576). Also, this only applies to requests where the source and destination span locations and/or storage classes.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

params.name: options.destinationEncryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key that will be used to encrypt the rewritten object.

params.name: options.destinationEncryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied destination encryption key. This value will be calculated from the destinationEncryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

params.name: options.destinationKmsKeyName
params.description: Name of the Cloud KMS key that will be used to encrypt the object. Should be in the format projects/my-project/locations/kr-location/keyRings/my-kr/cryptoKeys/my-key. Please note the KMS key ring must use the same location as the destination bucket.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifGenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the destination object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceGenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifSourceMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the source object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

methods.name: rename
methods.description:
Renames the object.

Please note that there is no atomic rename provided by the Storage API. This method is for convenience and is a set of sequential calls to copy and delete. Upon success the source object's metadata will be cleared, please use the returned object instead.

params.name: name
params.description: The new name.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl

params.name: options.destinationBucket
params.description: Will move to this bucket if set. If not set, will default to the same bucket.

methods.name: downloadAsString
methods.description:
Download an object as a string.

For an example of setting the range header to download a subrange of the object please see Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject::downloadAsStream().

resources.title: Learn more about the Range header.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: An AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation. If provided one must also include an encryptionKeySHA256.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: The SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation. If provided one must also include an encryptionKey.

Download an object to a specified location.

For an example of setting the range header to download a subrange of the object please see Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject::downloadAsStream().

methods.name: downloadAsStream
methods.description:
Download an object as a stream.

Please note Google Cloud Storage respects the Range header as specified by RFC7233. See below for an example of this in action.

examples.caption: Set the Range header in order to download a subrange of the object. For more examples of setting the Range header, please see RFC7233.

resources.title: Learn more about the Range header.

params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: The SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation. If provided one must also include an encryptionKey.

methods.name: downloadAsStreamAsync
methods.description:
Asynchronously download an object as a stream.

For an example of setting the range header to download a subrange of the object please see Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject::downloadAsStream().

examples.caption: Download all objects in a bucket asynchronously.

resources.title: Learn more about the Range header.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.encryptionKey

params.description: The SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation. If provided one must also include an encryptionKey.

methods.name: signedUrl
methods.description:
Create a Signed URL for this object.

Signed URLs can be complex, and it is strongly recommended you read and understand the documentation.

In cases where a keyfile is available, signing is accomplished in the client using your Service Account private key. In Google Compute Engine, signing is accomplished using IAM signBlob. Signing using IAM requires that your service account be granted the iam.serviceAccounts.signBlob permission, part of the "Service Account Token Creator" IAM role.

Additionally, signing using IAM requires different scopes. When creating an instance of Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageClient, provide the https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform scopein $options.scopes. This scope may be used entirely in place of the scopes provided in Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageClient.

App Engine and Compute Engine will attempt to sign URLs using IAM.

examples.caption: Create a signed URL allowing updates to the object.
Using Bucket-Bound hostnames By default, a custom bucket-bound hostname will use http as the schema rather than https. In order to get an https URI, we need to specify the proper scheme.
Using virtual hosted style URIs When true, returns a URL with the hostname <bucket>.storage.googleapis.com.

params.name: expires
params.description: Specifies when the URL will expire. May provide an instance of Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp, http://php.net/datetimeimmutable, or a UNIX timestamp as an integer.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.bucketBoundHostname
params.description: The hostname for the bucket, for instance cdn.example.com. May be used for Google Cloud Load Balancers or for custom bucket CNAMEs. Defaults to storage.googleapis.com.

params.name: options.contentMd5
params.description: The MD5 digest value in base64. If you provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same value in its request. If provided, take care to always provide this value as a base64 encoded string.

params.name: options.contentType
params.description: If you provide this value, the client must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

params.name: options.forceOpenssl
params.description: If true, OpenSSL will be used regardless of whether phpseclib is available. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.headers
params.description: If additional headers are provided, the server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values. Provide headers as a key/value array, where the key is the header name, and the value is an array of header values. Headers with multiple values may provide values as a simple array, or a comma-separated string. For a reference of allowed headers, see Reference Headers. Header values will be trimmed of leading and trailing spaces, multiple spaces within values will be collapsed to a single space, and line breaks will be replaced by an empty string. V2 Signed URLs may not provide x-goog-encryption-key or x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers.

params.name: options.keyFile
params.description: Keyfile data to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed. If $options.keyFilePath is set, this option is ignored.

params.name: options.keyFilePath
params.description: A path to a valid Keyfile to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed.

params.name: options.method
params.description: One of GET, PUT or DELETE. Defaults to GET.

params.name: options.responseDisposition
params.description: The response-content-disposition parameter of the signed url.

params.name: options.responseType
params.description: The response-content-type parameter of the signed url. When the server contentType is null, this option may be used to control the content type of the response.

params.name: options.saveAsName
params.description: The filename to prompt the user to save the file as when the signed url is accessed. This is ignored if $options.responseDisposition is set.

params.name: options.scheme
params.description: Either http or https. Only used if a custom hostname is provided via $options.bucketBoundHostname. If a custom bucketBoundHostname is provided, defaults to http. In all other cases, defaults to https.

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: One or more authentication scopes to be used with a key file. This option is ignored unless $options.keyFile or $options.keyFilePath is set.

params.name: options.queryParams
params.description: Additional query parameters to be included as part of the signed URL query string. For allowed values, see Reference Headers.

params.name: options.version
params.description: One of "v2" or "v4". Defaults to "v2".

params.name: options.virtualHostedStyle
params.description: If true, URL will be of form mybucket.storage.googleapis.com. If false, storage.googleapis.com/mybucket. Defaults to false.

exceptions.description: If the given expiration is invalid or in the past.
If the given `$options.method` is not valid.
If the given `$options.keyFilePath` is not valid.
If the given custom headers are invalid.
If the keyfile does not contain the required information.
If the credentials provided cannot be used for signing strings.

methods.name: signedUploadUrl
methods.description:
Create a Signed Upload URL for this object.

This method differs from Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject::signedUrl() in that it allows you to initiate a new resumable upload session. This can be used to allow non-authenticated users to insert an object into a bucket.

In order to upload data, a session URI must be obtained by sending an HTTP POST request to the URL returned from this method. See the Cloud Storage Documentation for more information.

If you prefer to skip this initial step, you may find Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject::beginSignedUploadSession() to fit your needs. Note that beginSignedUploadSession() cannot be used with Google Cloud PHP's Signed URL Uploader, and does not support a configurable expiration date.

params.name: expires
params.description: Specifies when the URL will expire. May provide an instance of Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp, http://php.net/datetimeimmutable, or a UNIX timestamp as an integer.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.contentMd5
params.description: The MD5 digest value in base64. If you provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same value in its request. If provided, take care to always provide this value as a base64 encoded string.

params.name: options.contentType
params.description: If you provide this value, the client must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

params.name: options.forceOpenssl
params.description: If true, OpenSSL will be used regardless of whether phpseclib is available. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.headers
params.description: If additional headers are provided, the server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values. Provide headers as a key/value array, where the key is the header name, and the value is an array of header values. Headers with multiple values may provide values as a simple array, or a comma-separated string. For a reference of allowed headers, see Reference Headers. Header values will be trimmed of leading and trailing spaces, multiple spaces within values will be collapsed to a single space, and line breaks will be replaced by an empty string. V2 Signed URLs may not provide x-goog-encryption-key or x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers.

params.name: options.keyFile
params.description: Keyfile data to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed. If $options.keyFilePath is set, this option is ignored.

params.name: options.keyFilePath
params.description: A path to a valid Keyfile to use in place of the keyfile with which the client was constructed.

params.name: options.responseDisposition
params.description: The response-content-disposition parameter of the signed url.

params.name: options.responseType
params.description: The response-content-type parameter of the signed url. When the server contentType is null, this option may be used to control the content type of the response.

params.name: options.saveAsName
params.description: The filename to prompt the user to save the file as when the signed url is accessed. This is ignored if $options.responseDisposition is set.

params.name: options.scheme
params.description: Either http or https. Only used if a custom hostname is provided via $options.bucketBoundHostname. In all other cases, https is used. When a custom bucketBoundHostname is provided, defaults to http.

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: One or more authentication scopes to be used with a key file. This option is ignored unless $options.keyFile or $options.keyFilePath is set.

params.name: options.queryParams
params.description: Additional query parameters to be included as part of the signed URL query string. For allowed values, see Reference Headers.

params.name: options.version
params.description: One of "v2" or "v4". Defaults to "v2".

methods.name: beginSignedUploadSession
methods.description:
Create a signed URL upload session.

The returned URL differs from the return value of Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject::signedUploadUrl() in that it is ready to accept upload data immediately via an HTTP PUT request.

Because an upload session is created by the client, the expiration date is not configurable. The URL generated by this method is valid for one week.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Retrieves the object's details. If no object data is cached a network request will be made to retrieve it.

params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: An AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation in order to retrieve the MD5 hash and CRC32C checksum. If provided one must also include an encryptionKeySHA256.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: The SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation in order to retrieve the MD5 hash and CRC32C checksum. If provided one must also include an encryptionKey.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation matches the given value.

params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation does not match the given value.

params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either 'full' or 'noAcl'.

methods.name: gcsUri
methods.description: Formats the object as a string in the following format: gs://{bucket-name}/{object-name}.
